conditions.name: Admission Rescheduling Condition
conditions.description: Condition for rescheduling admission to the CRU on Day 1.
conditions.text: Plasma Glucose (PG) level is not between 90 and 250 mg/dL on Day 1.

conditions.name: Stop Insulin Infusion Condition
conditions.description: Condition to stop the insulin infusion used to induce hypoglycemia.

conditions.name: TE ADA Positive Condition
conditions.text: Patient has treatment-emergent antidrug antibodies (TE ADA) at the follow-up/early discontinuation visit.

conditions.name: End of Additional Follow-up Criteria
conditions.description: Criteria to stop the additional follow-up for TE ADA.
conditions.text: Titer returns to baseline (within a single 2-fold dilution of the baseline titer) or 1 year has passed since the last dose of study treatment.

conditions.name: Interim Safety Review Trigger
conditions.description: A safety review is conducted after a specific number of patients complete Period 2.
conditions.text: Safety data will be reviewed after the first 6 patients are administered LY900018 in Period 2.

conditions.name: Study Continuation Post-Safety Review
conditions.description: Condition to continue dosing after the interim safety review.
conditions.text: No clinically significant safety findings for treatment or study procedure are noted in the first 6 patients.

conditions.name: Study Stopping Rule
conditions.description: The entire study may be stopped based on the interim safety review.
conditions.text: Study will be stopped if deemed necessary for patient safety following the review of safety data from the first 6 patients to complete Period 2 Day 1.

conditions.name: Patient Replacement Criteria
conditions.description: Condition for replacing a discontinued patient.
conditions.text: If patients discontinue from the study before completion of both periods with evaluable primary outcome for any reason, the patient may be replaced.

transitionRules.name: Screening to Treatment Transition
transitionRules.text: Eligible patients who have provided informed consent will be randomized on Day 1 of Period 1.

transitionRules.name: Period 1 to Period 2 Transition
transitionRules.text: After a washout period of 3 to 14 days, patients proceed from Period 1 to Period 2.

transitionRules.name: Transition to Additional Follow-up
transitionRules.text: Patients with TE ADA at follow-up/ED will undergo additional follow-up.

transitionRules.name: Handling of Inadvertently Enrolled Patients
transitionRules.text: If a patient did not meet enrollment criteria, documented approval from the sponsor is required for the patient to continue in the study.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Completion
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Completion of all protocol-required visits, including the final follow-up visit.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Discontinuation by Patient Decision
scheduleTimelineExits.description: The patient, or legal representative, requests to be withdrawn from the study.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Discontinuation by Investigator Decision
scheduleTimelineExits.description: The investigator decides that the patient should be discontinued from the study for any reason.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Discontinuation due to Other Study
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Enrollment in any other clinical study involving an investigational product or other incompatible medical research.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Discontinuation for Medical/Safety/Regulatory Reasons
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Participation needs to be stopped for medical, safety, regulatory, or other reasons consistent with applicable laws, regulations, and good clinical practice.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Lost to Follow-up
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A patient repeatedly fails to return for scheduled visits and is unable to be contacted by the study site.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Discontinuation for Safety
scheduleTimelineExits.description: The entire study is stopped for patient safety reasons based on the interim safety review of the first 6 patients.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Admission Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point to proceed with or reschedule admission based on PG levels.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Interim Safety Review Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point to continue or stop the study based on safety data from the initial cohort.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Additional Follow-up Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point to initiate additional follow-up based on TE ADA results.
